data.title: Changing sorting sequence does not have any impact in extension widget
data.body:
Testing #11120.

Insiders build from 8/30 on MacOS.
1. Open the extension widget
2. enter `@recommended @sort:installs-desc` in the text widget and press <kbd>return</kbd>
3. enter `@recommended @sort:installs-asa` in the text widget and press <kbd>return</kbd>
There is no change between 2 and 3.

data.title: multi line debug repl input doesn't support up/down arrows
data.body:
Testing #10996
- VSCode Version: 1.5.0-Insiders
- OS Version: Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Debug a nodejs app
2. Write multi line string in repl
3. Use up/down arrows

Now left/arrow works perfectly but since it's a mulit-line string, we should be able to use up/down to move the cursor inside the string as well, like Chrome Debug Console.

data.title: Scroll is gone after exiting vi in integrated terminal
data.body:
Testing #11134
- VSCode Version: 1.5.0-Insiders
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open integrated terminal
2. Run `vi`
3. Quit `vi`
4. The scrollbar is missing and the pane is not scrollable any more. If you press `<enter>` again, the scrollbar is back.

data.title: Icon theme json file shows warning if does not have `file` entry
data.body:
Testing #11131

Icon theme json file shows warning if does not have `file` entry. Icon themes work even if file icon is not set. So warning does not makes sense

data.title: Clearing VS built-in terminal on macOS
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4
- OS Version: macOS 10.11.6

With 1.3+ updates developers removed shortcut to clear integrated terminal output (previously it was Cmd+K). Is there any new shortcut for clearing output now?

data.title: Task behaves different from VS built-in terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4
- OS Version: macOS 10.11.6

Why running the same python file with simple command: `print("данные")` shows `UnicodeEncodeError: 'ascii' codec can't encode characters in position 0-5: ordinal not in range(128)` error if it's run as Task, while running the same file from built-in terminal shows output correctly?

data.title: Some options in intelli-sense for icon theme json file does not have documentation
data.body: Testing #11131 While writing icon theme json file, intelli-sense shows some options with out any documentation

data.title: Cannot read property 'id' of null
monaco-tree-row
data.body:
Hello everyone

As I can see ".monaco-tree-row" height is hardcoded, could you add option to customize it's height?

data.title: Replace with newline doesn't work

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.4.0 - OS Version: OS X 10.11.6 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Find text and replace with \n 2. Literal \n is used instead of a newline **Input** **Actual** **Expected** Regex mode works as expected however I'd rather not have to define a regex.

data.title: Ctrl-E doesn't work as expected once you resize the window
data.body:
Testing #11127

VSCode Version: 1.5.0-Insiders
OS Version: OSX
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a file whose content is more than 1 page long
2. Run ctrl-e on the second line. It works as charm.
3. Use mouse to resize the window.
4. Repeat Step 2. The line does scrolling downwards but less than 1 line.

data.title: code --version should print version number and commit id
data.body: `code --version` currently prints the version number such as `1.4.0`.  In order to make it easier for people to file issues we should also output the platform and the commit id in addition to the version.

data.title: Terminal scrolling disabled after quitting vim
data.body:
Testing #11134.
- VSCode Version:  08/30 insiders
- OS Version: MacOS

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open integrated terminal
1. run a command with a long output such as `npm list -g`
1. open a long file in `vi` 
1. within vi enter `:q`
1. no scrollbar, mouse scrolling doesn't work anymore
1. resize the window
1. everything is back to working as expected

data.title: Add support for macOS NSFindPboard as an action

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Support for macOS's `NSFindPboard`, which is a global shared find buffer.  Which allows one to put text into the find buffer from other native apps like Chrome, TextEdit, Safari, Sublime, etc. and then switch to other Cocoa apps and use `cmd-g` to find next matching text.

I suggest binding this new action to `cmd-e` for ux sensibility on macOS.

from https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3431#issuecomment-239508682

> Based on actions.find in VSCode, each open buffer seems to have it's own (non-shared) find pasteboard. So actions.find works fine in a single buffer, but I can't cmd-e some text in one file, then cmd-g it in my next file...

We need to add a new action/function such as `editor.action.addSelectionToNextFindMatchInGlobalBuffer` which may work in other systems as well, but initially for macOS.

Electron will likely need modifications to expose an API capturing the `NSFindPboard`. 
ref: https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4650#issuecomment-130619175

Alternatively, we can execute a shell script to gain access to the global find pasteboard in macOS with `pbpaste -pboard find`.
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: macOS

/cc @bpasero

data.title: Ctrl-E, Ctrl-Y doesn't work if the file is no more than one page long
data.body:
Testing #11127
- VSCode Version: 1.5.0-Insiders
- OS Version: OSX

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a file with few content, like just three lines
2. Run `ctrl-e` on the second line

The line should be moved upward, but right now it does nothing.

data.body: Similar to how we show this for themes:

data.title: Select "Find more themes in marketplace" resets my selected theme
data.body: On Mac OS X I bring up the theme picker and click on the last entry. Doing so my theme resets to the Dark theme (it was light before).

data.title: Flickering red underlines in code with errors
Editor does not open when working offline
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.4.0 (6276dcb0ae497766056b4c09ea75be1d76a8b679, 2016-08-04T16:45:31.680Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586

I am trying to edit some php, html, css and js file on my local development machine, while working I had turnoff the internet. To my surprise it does not open when I double click on the icon from my desktop. I have also tried several other way to open it but no luck. 
I turn on the internet and it is working again. This is strange for me
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Turn off the internet
2. Open it

data.title: Rename input field not nice for folders without icons
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/11130
- use the seti theme
- bring up the rename/create box

=> the input field looks off because it does not have a folder icon

data.title: Markdown links that are broken across lines aren't highlighted correctly

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.6 (15G31)

In a Markdown file if a link label is broken across multiple lines (common if you wrap text) it isn't highlighted. For example in:

```
[This is
an example](https://example.com/)
[another example](https://example.com)
```

the first link label is not highlighted while the second is.

data.title: VS Code Insiders won't update (Windows)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.0-insider (2016-08-26)
- OS Version: Windows 10 AU (64bit)

When a new version is available, the "help -> check for updates" menu turns into "Downloading update...", and when it's ready to be installed I get a pop up asking me if I want to do so.

The problem is that since a few versions, the menu is stuck displaying "Downloading update...", and never displays me the popup.

data.title: When typing a 2nd single quote, the quote gets doubled

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.4.0 (6276dcb0ae497766056b4c09ea75be1d76a8b679, 2016-08-04T16:45:31.680Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Write a function that has an object as argument (function (myobject) .... ) 
2.  Now you decide to pass a string as a parameter.  Type a first single quote to define the argument that is passed as string (function (**'**myobject) ... ) 
3.  Type the second quote to close the string.  (function ('myobject**'**) ... ) 
   Now you get  (function ('myobject**''**) ... )

data.title: Support that 'Open in New Command' uses the integrated terminal
data.body:
Today the Open in Command always uses an external terminal. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/18092986/ae2fcfb4-6ece-11e6-8c01-60433b43ccec.png)

Now that we have an internal terminal, I'd like that I can configure that this command uses the integrated terminal and opens an integrated terminal on the selected folder.

data.title: Make --performance flag work with opening a second window
data.body:
- run the following command: `code --performance`
- run `F1 > Show Startup Perf`
- wait a little ~30sec
- open another blank window of VS Code
- run `F1 > Show Start Perf`
- 🐛 the value of `Total` seems to include the wait time from step 3

data.title: Mode detection doesn't work when file doesn't exist, from CLI, from extension mode
data.body:
Testing #11023

Run `code file.js`, given that `file.js` does not exist. It won't be detected as a JavaScript file. 😭

data.title: Code --help shows wrong app name
data.body:
`Usage: code ...`

It should read

`Usage: code-insiders...`

data.title: "eslint.nodePath" requires vscode restart
data.body:
Refs: #11100 
1. Simple workspace, with no eslint installed.
2. Open settings and set "eslint.nodePath" to some path where eslint is installed
3. Notice that this path is not picked up until vscode gets restarted

This is very confusing for the user since there is an action to 'Retry' and this action does not do anything. A real restart is required
